column1: ROB_0325.jpg;Femoral neck fracture;Femoral neck fracture: Any fracture centered between a line drawn at the distal extent of femoral head articular cartilage and the intertrochanteric line distally are subcapital or femoral neck fractures. A transcervical femoral neck fracture is when the top part of your thigh bone
column3: cracks all the way through from one side to the other. This is serious because it can cut off the blood supply to the top of your thigh bone
column4: which can lead to more problems.

column1: AO_0037.jpg;Trochanteric fracture;A trochanteric hip fracture occurs between the greater trochanter
column2: where the gluteus medius and the gluteus minimus (hip extensors and abductors) attach
column4: where the iliopsoas (hip flexor) attaches. An Intertrochanteric Fracture is a break in the bone between two prominent parts
column5: named the greater and lesser trochanters
column6: near the hip. Unlike other kinds of fractures
column7: this one usually doesn't affect the blood flow to the bone
column8: which is good because it might be easier to fix. However
column9: when the break goes in a specific direction between these points
column10: it can make the bone more unstable and harder to treat.

column2: trochanteric region fracture: Any fracture centered below the intertrochanteric line (a) and above a horizontal transverse line at the inferior border of the lesser trochanter(b).Trochanteric fractures can be divided according to the line into pertrochanteric or intertrochanteric. It is a type of fracture that affects the femur in the region of the trochanters. The greater trochanter is a bony prominence at the top of the femur where important muscles such as the glutes are inserted
column3: while the lesser trochanter is a prominence below the femoral neck where the psoas-iliac muscle
column5: is inserted.  Intertrochanteric Fracture: This is a type of broken bone in the hip area happening between two parts known as the greater and lesser trochanters. Unlike other kinds of fractures
column6: this doesn't cut off blood flow to the bone
column7: which can make it a bit easier to fix. However
column8: because of how the break is angled between those two points
column9: these fractures can be trickier and more challenging to treat properly.
